abilitygroupdescription.p: The art of communing with the unquiet dead is at best the province of shysters and charlatans and at worst an art that plays with things that no man ought. It's practice is viewed with disdain by all right thinking peoples.

abilitydescription.p: While holding part of the deceased's body the necromancer may ask questions of the dead person. If the spell succeeds the dead person will respond to questions telepathically. After each question roll a D4, on a 1 the link with the spirit has been broken and no more questions can be asked.

Answers will be heard only by the necromancer and will be heard as a voice in the head. The necromancer must ask the question in a language understood by the spirit and the spirit will respond in a language they understood during their lifetime. The spirit that is contacted is under no compulsion to reply and may ignore the character, lie in its responses or answer how it pleases.
The newly dead are often disorientated by their experience and may not realize that they are in fact dead. If death is sudden or traumatic a spirit may not remember it.

Characters may only attempt to commune with a particular dead person once. Whether they succeed or fail in their first attempt they will never be able to successfully commune with that person again as the things that keep the gates between life and death are vigillant and fearsome.
summoned might attack (need to exert will over them?) handle failure of magic

abilitycheck.name: Cast
abilitycheck.critsuccess: Melee attacks against the caster deal 3x damage to the attacker
abilitycheck.righteoussuccess: Melee attacks against the caster deal 2x damage to the attacker
abilitycheck.success: Melee attacks against the caster deal damage to the attacker

abilitydescription.p: The caster is warded. Any attacker doing damage in melee to the caster also suffers the same amount of damage. This spell lasts for the length of combat.

The caster grafts the fresh flesh of one creature onto another. Without the appropriate skeletal, vascular and muscular support the new flesh will not be usable by the subject, you can graft an extra arm to a subject but they will not be able to use it. You can however replace an existing limb with another or restore a previously amputated limb. Note that you cannot use this spell to replace the head of a creature. Once decapitated the creature is dead.

If successfully cast, chanting this psalm makes it hard for the undead to see and hear the caster. After an attack is made against the character by an undead creature, the caster can make a save against that attack by making a Std+3Ã—Rank check against the undeads perception. If successful the undead creature cannot make the attack and loses their attack for that round. This save is a free action that happens before any defensive ability, dodge, made by the caster.

The school of necromancy is concerned with the use of death or blood magic, the legends of the dread necromancers and the unquiet dead. Characters may provide useful information about these topics on occasion: identifying undead, and or their weaknesses, and providing the relevant mythology around these creatures.
The character holds death at bay for a moment. The target can reroll a single near-death roll. This spell may be cast once per character per day. If successful the target may reroll a death roll.

abilitycheck.name: Cast
abilitycheck.effect: In the presence of blood, summon a demon to fight.

abilitydescription.p: In the presence of a lot of blood the character can summon a Blood Soucriant. A female demon, temptress and drinker of blood. The demon will not tarry long and once summoned will drink of the blood of the living. If the Blood Sucreant does not drink she will attack the caster.

If successfully cast, chanting this psalm creates a dark cloud surrounding the caster with a radius of 20'6m. This cloud gives +3Ã—Rank to defensive rolls against missile attacks. It is clearly visible during the day, but may not be noticeable at night depending on the lighting. The cloud also provides +Rank against area-of-effect attacks.

The character appears as if dead. This is not an illusion. They look, smell, and feel like a corpse. They may also adopt a preternatural stillness. At rank 1 the character can appear as a fresh corpse, dead for a few hours, at rank 3 they can appear as a corpse that has been rotting in the weather for a few weeks.
